title: Wörishofer
text:
Wörishofer is a type of <a href="orthopaedic%20footwear">orthopaedic</a> ladies' <a href="sandal">sandal</a> made in <a href="Bad%20W%C3%B6rishofen">Bad Wörishofen</a>. They have a <a href="Cork%20%28material%29">cork</a> wedge in the sole which is light and acts as a <a href="shock%20absorber">shock absorber</a>. They were first designed in the 1940s and have been considered practical but ugly. But in 2010, they became fashionable, being worn by celebrities such as <a href="Kirsten%20Dunst">Kirsten Dunst</a> and <a href="Maggie%20Gyllenhaal">Maggie Gyllenhaal</a>. They may be compared to other practical shoes which have been fashionable, including <a href="Birkenstocks">Birkenstocks</a>, <a href="crocs">crocs</a>, <a href="Dr.%20Martens">Dr. Martens</a>, <a href="Dr.%20Scholl%27s">Dr. Scholl's</a> and <a href="Ugg%20boots">Ugg boots</a>.
<a href="Podiatrist">Podiatrist</a> Beverley Ashdown rated them 8/10 in a comparison with other fashionable ugly shoes.
